Comment: Black doesn't try to defend has advance pawn.
... so that white equalises. Lancelot is now on the center.
developping and menacing white's central pawn.
Later or sooner, Lancelot will have to retreat (if 6. ... e5).
7. Bd3 or 7. Bc4 were other candidate moves. 7. Be2 is quieter. It gives possibilities of attacks by the d1 h5 diagonal
Black doesn't opt for a fiancheto, more common in a Sicilian, probably to prevent 9. Bg5
... so that white opts for Be3 (only proper place for the DSB)
I felt a bit cramped. Black's position is very solid and I see little attacking possibilities. At least 10. Nd4 enables 11. b3
Probably to menace the c3 knight if 11.b3. It also aims at h2.

Menacing c6, defending e4 in case of 11. d5 but forbiding 12. Nf3. White is stronger at the center but the position is not very comfortable. I have the impression that black has more available options
